intro: Sida angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers in clusters, which are followed by three-lobed capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Sida angustifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
